study_id.description: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this study

institutionCode.description: The name (or acronym) representing the lead institution responsible for the study.

title.description: An official title for the study or project. Project title should be fewer than 30 words, such as a title of a grant proposal or a publication.
title.example: Study of single cells in the human body

description.description: A detailed description of the project which includes research goals and experimental approach. Project description should be fewer than 300 words, such as an abstract from a grant application or publication.
description.example: This project explores the intricate details of single cells in the human body, focusing on their structure, function, and behavior. By studying individual cells, it aims to uncover how they contribute to overall health, disease progression, and human biology. This research can provide deeper insights into cellular processes, paving the way for advancements in medical treatments and personalised medicine.

bibliographicCitation.description: A citation for the study resource, following a standard format.
bibliographicCitation.example: Doe J., et al. (2024). Single Cell Transcriptomic Analysis of Human Liver Cells. Journal of Cellular Biology.

created.description: The date when the study was created or registered.
created.error: Date study was created is required

technology.description: The sorting or visualisation technology used.

study_id.description: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the study.

sample_id.description: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier assigned to the sample in the study.

scientificName.description: The full scientific name of the species studied.

strain.description: An identifier of the strain of the organism, if applicable.

tissue.description: The type of tissue sampled for the study.

preservation_method.description: A brief description of how the sample was preserved.

collection_date.description: The date when the sample was collected with year, month and day specified in the format, YYYY-MM-DD.

geographic_location_latitude.description: The geographic latitude where the specimen or sample was taken in decimal degrees, between -90 and 90. Locations should be specified to a minimum of 3 decimal places and a maximum of 8 decimal places. Reference: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decimal_degree.

geographic_location_longitude.description: The geographic longitude where the specimen or sample was taken in decimal degrees, between -180 and 180. Locations should be specified to a minimum of 3 decimal places and maximum of 8 decimal places. Reference: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decimal_degrees.

broad_scale_environmental_context.description: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). Reference: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.
broad_scale_environmental_context.error: Broad scale environmental context is required

local_scale_environmental_context.description: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling.
local_scale_environmental_context.error: Local scale environmental context is required

environmental_medium.description: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling.

dissociation_protocol_id.description: A unique alphanumeric code for the dissociation protocol in the study

protocol_name.description: A descriptive name of the protocol used for single-cell sequencing.

dissociation_description.description: A free-text description of the process used to separate cells from tissues or cell aggregates.
dissociation_description.example: Tissue was enzymatically dissociated using collagenase for 30 minutes.

enrichment_markers.description: A free-text description of the markers used to enrich specific cell types during single-cell isolation.

isolation_kit.description: The kit used to isolate the cells.

literature_source_reference.description: Reference to literature sources that describe the protocol or methods used.
literature_source_reference.example: Doe et al. (2024), 'Single-cell RNA-seq: A comprehensive overview'

protocols_io_reference.description: Reference link to protocols.io for additional details on the protocol.

workflow_hub_SOP_reference.description: Reference to the Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) in workflow hub.
workflow_hub_SOP_reference.error: Workflow hub SOP reference is required.

dissociation_protocol_method.description: The method used to dissociate tissues into single cells.

single_cell_quality_metric.description: Metrics used to assess the quality of single cells before sequencing.
single_cell_quality_metric.error: Single Cell Quality Metric is required

sample_id.description: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier assigned to the cell suspension for the sample in the study.

dissociation_protocol_id.description: A unique alphanumeric code for the dissociation protocol in the study

cell_suspension_id.description: A unique alphanumeric code for the cell suspension for the sample

suspension_type.description: The type of suspension used to keep cells in solution during processing.

cell_count.description: An integer representing the number of cells in the sequencing library.

cell_viability.description: The percentage of living cells in a sample, indicating the health and quality of cells for RNA-sequencing analysis.

cell_viability_assessment_method.description: TThe method used to evaluate the viability of cells in the sample, often involving staining or flow cytometry techniques.

cell_size.description: The size of the cell, typically measured in micrometres.

suspension_volume_\u00b5l.description: The volume of the cell suspension in microlitres.

suspension_concentration_cells_per_\u00b.description: The concentration of cells in the suspension.
suspension_concentration_cells_per_\u00b.error: Suspension concentration cells per Μl is required

suspension_dilution.description: The dilution factor of the cell suspension.

loading_volume_\u00b5l.description: The volume of the cell suspension loaded into the single-cell RNA-sequencing system for analysis.

suspension_dilution_buffer.description: A solution used to dilute cell suspensions to a desired concentration, typically prior to loading cells into a device for single-cell RNA sequencing. It helps maintain cell viability and integrity during processing.
suspension_dilution_buffer.example: PBS (Phosphate-buffered saline) with 0.04% BSA (Bovine serum albumin)

library_preparation_id.description: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the library preparation protocol used during the sequencing.

cell_suspension_id.description: A unique alphanumeric code for the cell suspension for the library preparation.

library_preparation_kit.description: The kit used for library preparation.

library_preparation_kit_version.description: The version number of the library preparation kit used for sequencing.
library_preparation_kit_version.error: Library preparation kit version is required

amplification_method.description: The method used to amplify the Complementary DNA (cDNA).

cDNA_amplification_cycles.description: The number of cycles used during the Complementary DNA (cDNA) amplification process.

average_size_distribution_bp.description: The average length of RNA fragments in base pairs (BP) after library preparation, indicating the quality and suitability of the RNA for sequencing.

library_construction_method.description: The library construction method (including version) that was used.

input_molecule.description: The specific fraction of biological macromolecule from which the sequencing library is derived.

primer.description: The type of primer used for reverse transcription. This allows users to identify content of the cDNA library input for mRNA.

primeness.description: The end from which the molecule was sequenced.

library_strand.description: The Complementary DNA (cDNA) strand of the library from which the reads derived from - sense (first), antisense (second), both or none.

spike_in.description: External RNA added to the sample as a control to assess technical variability and normalization in RNA-sequencing. State whether spike-in was used.

spike_type.description: The specific type of external RNA used for spiking in, often indicating the source or nature of the control RNA.

spike_in_dilution_or_concentration.description: The final concentration or dilution (for commercial sets) of the spike in mix.
spike_in_dilution_or_concentration.error: Spike in dilution or concentration is required

i5_index.description: Barcode sequence used on the i5 adapter during library preparation for identifying samples in multiplexed single-cell RNA-sequencing.

i7_index.description: Barcode sequence used on the i7 adapter to distinguish samples in multiplexed sequencing runs.

dual_single_index.description: Specifies if both i5 and i7 indices (dual) or only one index (single) was used for sample identification during sequencing.
dual_single_index.error: Dual or Single Index is required

index_length.description: The length (in base pairs) of the index sequences used (i5 and/or i7).

i5_sequence.description: The nucleotide sequence of the i5 index used in multiplexing during sequencing.

i7_sequence.description: The specific nucleotide sequence of the i7 index used for a sample.

plate_id.description: Identifier for the 96-well plate used in sample preparation.

well_row.description: The row identifier in a 96-well plate indicating the sample's position.

well_col.description: The column identifier in a 96-well plate indicating the sample's position.

cell_phenotype.description: The cell marker for the Fluorescence-Activated Cell Sorting (FACS) of cells.

sequencing_id.description: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the sequencing protocol.

sequencing_platform_name.description: The name of the sequencing platform used for the experiment.

sequencing_instrument_model.description: This refers to the machine or platform used for sequencing, with variations in throughput, read lengths, error rates, and application suitability.

library_layout.description: The type of library layout used for sequencing.

desired_reads_per_cell.description: The ideal number of sequencing reads to be generated per cell.
desired_reads_per_cell.error: Desired reads per cell is required

UMI_barcode_read.description: The type of read that contains the Unique Molecular Identifier (UMI) barcode.

UMI_barcode_offset.description: The offset in sequence of the Unique Molecular Identifier (UMI) identifying barcode.

UMI_barcode_size.description: The size of the Unique Molecular Identifier (UMI) identifying barcode.

cDNA_read.description: The actual nucleotide sequence obtained from Complementary DNA (cDNA) during sequencing.

cDNA_read_offset.description: The starting position of the Complementary DNA (cDNA) read within the entire sequence, indicating where the read begins after any barcodes or technical sequences.

cDNA_read_size.description: The size of the Complementary DNA (cDNA) read.

library_preparation_id.description: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the library preparation protocol used during the sequencing.

sequencing_id.description: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the sequencing protocol.

read_1_file.description: The name of the file that contains read 1.

read_2_file.description: The name of the file that contains read 2.

index_1_file.description: The name of the file that contains index 1.

index_2_file.description: The name of the file that contains index 2.

read_checksum.description: Result of a hash function calculated on the content of both the read 1 file and the read 2 file to verify file integrity. Commonly used algorithms include MD5 and SHA-1. The checksums should be separated by a comma (,).

index_checksum.description: Result of a hash function calculated on the content of both the index 1 file and the index 2 file to verify file integrity. Commonly used algorithms include MD5 and SHA-1. The checksums should be separated by a comma (,).

white_list_barcode_file.description:
A file containing the known cell barcodes in the
dataset.
white_list_barcode_file.error: White List Barcode File is required

file_derived_from.description: The name of the file that was used to generate the analysis derived data.

inferred_cell_type.description: Post analysis cell type or identity declaration based on expression profile or known gene function identified by the performer.

post_analysis_cell_well_quality.description:
Performer defined measure of whether the read output
from the cell was included in the sequencing analysis. For example, cells might be excluded if a threshold percentage of reads did not map to the genome or if pre-sequencing quality measures were not passed.
post_analysis_cell_well_quality.error: Post analysis cell well quality is required

other_derived_cell_attributes.description: Any other cell level measurement or annotation as result of the analysis.
other_derived_cell_attributes.error: Other derived cell attributes is required

reference_genome.description: Indicate version and include stable link to genome data (or attach genome fasta file).

genome_annotation.description: Indicate version and include stable link. Also indicate if any modification to the original annotation has been applied (e.g. 3' UTR extension) and include modified annotation file employed in the analysis.

annotation_filtering.description: Indicate which features were filtered (i.e. protein coding, pseudo-genes, TCRs, etc.)
annotation_filtering.example: Filtered to include only protein-coding genes

genes_vs_exons.description: Quantification using whole gene intervals or exons.

read_mapping_statistics.description: Statistics of the Reads or Unique Molecular Identifier (UMI).

sequencing_saturation.description: Depending on number of cells recovered (not targeted) and technology

UMIs_barcode_distribution_qc.description: Show Unique Molecular Identifiers (UMIs) per barcode distribution and threshold applied

cell_non_cell_filtering_strategy.description: Unique Molecular Identifier (UMI) threshold used to discriminate cells from non-cells. Description of algorithm (if any) and parameters used to determine cells or non-cells.

other_quality_filters_applied.description: Cells/nuclei discarded based on % mitochondrial reads, % rRNA reads, etc.

ambient_rna_qc.description: Report % UMIs in background cell barcodes, and algorithm (if any) used to remove ambient RNA
ambient_rna_qc.example: Ambient RNA removed if >5% UMIs in background barcodes

predicted_doublet_rate_qc.description: Depending on number of cells recovered (not targeted) and technology

individual_organism_snp_demultiplexing.description: If carried out, show SNP partitioning quality (e.g. SNP UMAP embedding or covariance matrix), algorithm used

source_code.description: If any newly developed code/software has been used in the processing and downstream analysis of the dataset.
source_code.example: Source code is hosted on GitHub and includes custom algorithms for UMI count normalization. The repository can be found at: https://github.com/user/umi-normalization.

UMI_count_matrix.description: Gene x cell matrix with UMI counts for each gene in each cell.
UMI_count_matrix.example: The UMI count matrix is stored in a CSV file with gene IDs as rows (e.g., ENSG00000139618) and cell barcodes as columns (e.g., Cell_001, Cell_002). The matrix file is available at: https://example.com/UMI_count_matrix.csv.

ensembl_ids.description: Gene or transcript names should be listed as Ensembl (or other standardized ID), with gene short names in metadata.
ensembl_ids.example: The UMI count matrix includes genes identified by their Ensembl IDs, such as 'ENSG00000139618' for the BRCA1 gene. See the full list of Ensembl IDs in the metadata file.

functional_gene_annotations.description: Any functional annotation generated/used (gene names, GOs, structural domains, etc.).
functional_gene_annotations.example: Functional gene annotations, including Gene Ontology (GO) terms, are provided in the metadata. For example, the gene 'ENSG00000139618' (BRCA1) is annotated with the GO term 'GO:0003674' (DNA binding).

protein_models.description: FASTA file with (or stable link to) the predicted proteins associated to genes in the UMI count matrix and matching IDs.
protein_models.example: The protein sequences for genes are provided in a FASTA file available at: https://example.com/protein_models.fasta, where each protein sequence is linked to the corresponding gene ID.

cell_metadata.description: Table mapping cell IDs to cluster/cell type/broad cell type annotations.
cell_metadata.example: Cell metadata includes information such as cell type annotations ('Tumor', 'Normal') and experimental conditions ('Control', 'Treatment'). This data is available in a table at: https://example.com/cell_metadata.csv.

cluster_level_normalised_expression_tabl.description: Expression tables that show normalized gene expression at the cluster or cell-type level.
cluster_level_normalised_expression_tabl.example: Normalised gene expression data at the cluster level is provided in a tab-delimited text file. For example, gene 'ENSG00000139618' (BRCA1) has expression values for clusters: Cluster_1: 1200, Cluster_2: 900. The full expression table is available at: https://example.com/cluster_level_expression.csv.

other_resource_files.description: Necessary to re-use and interpret the data. E.g. barcode information in complex, serial multiplexing protocols (clicktags).
other_resource_files.example: Barcode information used in multiplexing protocols is provided in a separate file, which can be accessed at: https://example.com/barcode_data.csv.
